splash.body: Would you like something to be different in your life? Below are some of thecommonest things people talk to us about. Pick one, and be guided through atried and tested 5 steps to help you make the change.

1.data: Where do I want to be?

Think about this part of your life and what youâ€™d like to be different. Write it down in a single sentence. It needs to be something that:

  • Is real
  • Really matters to you
  • You have control over
  • Is for you, not for someone else

1.data:
Give yourself a minute to really imagine what it would be like if you made this change and if you could give yourself 10 out of 10:
What would it feel like?
What would you be doing?
What would people be saying to you?
What difference would it make to your life?

Making a change can sometimes feel too much. Let's think about how you wantthings to be and how near or far you are from that.

Mark this out of 10, 1 being no where near, 10 being you're there, everything is ok.

data.body: You entered a low number so we are responding with a corresponding snippet of text...
You entered a medium number so we are responding with a corresponding snippet of text...
You entered a high number so we are responding with a corresponding snippet of text...

1.data: Make a plan to get there?

In step 1, we asked to imagine a situation where you could give yourself 10/10.

What are all the things you need to do to get to that point? Think of everything andlist them in no particular order, below.
Select above what you are going to do first? When exactly are you going to do it?The more specific you are the more it will help you.

Now think about how much you want to make this change. Give yourself a minuteto really imagine what it would be like to actually do this.Now rate your commitment on a scale of 1 â€“ 10, 1 meaning you are not committedand donâ€™t care if this happens or not and 10 meaning you are totally committedand will do everything to make sure this happens.

1.data: Now youâ€™ve spent some time thinking about what you want to change,enter your email address below. We will send you both your scores andthe plan youâ€™ve made, plus links to other helpful resources such as:
